How the 2024 Olympics transformed Greater Paris into a supersized stadium
description: Previously unpublished data on visitor numbers in Paris and its suburbs during the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games reveal how the city and its residents adapted, and how the Games accelerated Paris's transformation.

West Bank residents await bulldozers after Israel approves E1 settlement project
description: The 5,000 Palestinians living on the small territory separating East Jerusalem from the Israeli settlement of Ma'ale Adumim have been ordered to evacuate. The operation to destroy their homes could begin as early as Thursday, burying the possibility of a Palestinian state.

headline: Zelensky says could meet Putin only after allies agree on Ukraine security guarantees
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Thursday accused Ukraine of making unrealistic security demands, saying that any deployment of European troops to the country would be 'absolutely unacceptable.'

headline: Violence against women: 'France would benefit from implementing a unified policy under a specialized prosecutor's office'
description: In France, national prosecutors for financial crime and anti-terrorism have proven effective. Gender-based violence warrants the same level of action and coordination, writes Vanessa Bousardo, vice president of the Paris Bar Association.

headline: 'Marthe Robin was attacked all her life': Catholic mystic's hometown faces disputes over legacy
description: 'Marthe Robin, Saint Or Fraud?' (4/5). Accusations of deception against the Catholic mystic continue to cast a shadow – and even divide – inhabitants of her village.

In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
description: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

headline: The rise and fall of a gang of crypto-ransom kidnappers
description: The criminal group behind a string of violent kidnappings in France that recently made headlines started this activity as early as 2023 and was planning further 'attacks.' Its mastermind was arrested on June 3 in Morocco.

headline: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
description: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.
